questions.text: I warm up quickly to others
I keep others at a distance
I am hard to get to know
I enjoy being part of a crowd
I wait for others to lead the way
I like to take it easy
I am always on the go
I prefer a slow pace of life
I have a lot of fun
I suspect hidden motives in others
I believe others have good intentions
I always say what I think
I help others without being asked
I look out only for myself
I am indifferent to others' needs
I dislike being the center of attention
I like to be seen as superior
I don't like to draw attention to myself
I am not interested in other people's problems
I remain unaffected by others' suffering
I am very competent at what I do
I excel in what I do
I keep things neat and tidy
I often forget to put things back
I work hard to achieve my goals
I do just enough work to get by
I set low standards for myself
I find it difficult to get down to work
I need a push to get started
I am relaxed most of the time
I am very pleased with myself
I find it difficult to approach others
I am afraid of drawing attention to myself
I am comfortable in unfamiliar situations
I never spend more than I can afford
I seldom get lost in thought
I believe in the importance of art
I do not enjoy going to art museums
I see beauty others might not notice
I rarely notice my emotional reactions
I don't understand people who get emotional
I like to visit new places
I am attached to conventional ways
I like to solve complex problems
I have no interest in theoretical discussions
I tend to vote for liberal political candidates
I believe we should be tough on crime
I believe laws should be strictly enforced
I believe that there is no absolute right or wrong

option_a.text: Seek out new people to meet and talk with many guests

option_b.text: Have deep conversations with one or two people I know well

questions.text: When working on a project, I prefer to:

option_a.text: Collaborate with a team and bounce ideas off others

option_b.text: Work independently and think through problems myself

questions.text: After a busy week, I recharge by:

option_a.text: Going out with friends or attending social events

option_b.text: Spending quiet time alone or with very close friends

option_a.text: Think out loud and share ideas as they come to me

option_b.text: Think carefully before speaking and share well-formed ideas

questions.text: I prefer phone conversations that are:

option_a.text: Spontaneous and can go in any direction

option_b.text: Planned with a specific purpose in mind

option_a.text: Like to talk through solutions with others

option_b.text: Need quiet time to think things through alone

option_a.text: Find it easy to start conversations with strangers

option_b.text: Prefer to be introduced or wait for others to approach me

option_a.text: Lots of activities and meeting new people

option_b.text: Peaceful relaxation and minimal social interaction

questions.text: When learning something new, I prefer to:

option_a.text: Join a class or study group

option_b.text: Study on my own using books or online resources

questions.text: My energy level is highest when:

option_a.text: I'm interacting with people and engaged in activities

option_b.text: I have time for quiet reflection and focused work

option_a.text: Have many friends and enjoy large social circles

option_b.text: Have a few close friends and prefer intimate gatherings

option_a.text: Tell many people and enjoy sharing my experiences

option_b.text: Share only with a select few trusted individuals

option_a.text: Expressive and animated

option_b.text: Calm and measured

questions.text: When learning something new, I focus on:

option_a.text: Practical applications and real-world examples

option_b.text: Underlying theories and conceptual frameworks

option_a.text: Concrete, factual, and based on experience

option_b.text: Theoretical, innovative, and based on possibilities

option_a.text: Clear, literal descriptions with specific details

option_b.text: Metaphorical language that suggests deeper meanings

questions.text: When solving problems, I rely more on:

option_a.text: Past experience and proven methods

option_b.text: Intuition and novel approaches

option_a.text: What is actual and present

option_b.text: What is possible and future

questions.text: When describing something, I tend to:

option_a.text: Give specific details and stick to facts

option_b.text: Use analogies and talk about impressions

option_a.text: Lay out information step-by-step with clear examples

option_b.text: Encourage exploration of concepts and connections

questions.text: When starting a new project, I first:

option_a.text: Identify what resources and steps are needed

option_b.text: Envision the end result and overall purpose

option_a.text: Specific details like colors, sounds, and textures

option_b.text: Patterns, meanings, and relationships between things

option_a.text: Provide turn-by-turn instructions with landmarks

option_b.text: Give a general sense of direction and destination

option_a.text: Dealing with concrete facts and current realities

option_b.text: Exploring ideas and future possibilities

option_a.text: Practical, hands-on activities

option_b.text: Theoretical, conceptual discussions

option_a.text: Logic and objective analysis

option_b.text: Personal values and how others will be affected

questions.text: When giving feedback, I tend to:

option_a.text: Be direct and focus on what needs improvement

option_b.text: Be tactful and emphasize positives first

questions.text: I believe the best decisions are based on:

option_a.text: Impartial analysis of pros and cons

option_b.text: Consideration of people's feelings and values

questions.text: In conflicts, I focus more on:

option_a.text: Finding the truth and fair solution

option_b.text: Maintaining harmony and relationships

option_a.text: Logical arguments and evidence

option_b.text: Personal stories and emotional appeals

questions.text: When someone is upset, I first:

option_a.text: Try to solve the problem causing distress

option_b.text: Offer emotional support and understanding

option_a.text: Competence and achievement

option_b.text: Compassion and cooperation

option_a.text: Does this make logical sense?

option_b.text: Does this align with my values?

questions.text: I prefer work environments that emphasize:

option_a.text: Fair policies applied consistently to everyone

option_b.text: Individual needs and circumstances

option_a.text: Prove my point with facts and logic

option_b.text: Find common ground and understanding

option_a.text: Illogical or inefficient systems

option_b.text: Insensitive or uncaring behavior

questions.text: My decisions are guided more by:

option_a.text: My head and rational analysis

option_b.text: My heart and personal values

option_a.text: Logical and fair-minded

option_b.text: Warm and empathetic

option_a.text: Have things decided and settled

option_b.text: Keep options open and flexible

option_a.text: Create detailed itineraries and book in advance

option_b.text: Leave room for spontaneous discoveries

option_a.text: I have clear deadlines and structured plans

option_b.text: I can adapt as I go and explore different approaches

option_a.text: Organized with everything in its place

option_b.text: Flexible with things where I last used them

option_a.text: Tasks are completed and off my list

option_b.text: I'm in the middle of exploring possibilities

option_a.text: Make a list and stick to it

option_b.text: Browse and buy what catches my interest

option_a.text: Have clear goals and defined endpoints

option_b.text: Evolve and can go in different directions

option_a.text: Frustrate me and throw me off track

option_b.text: Excite me with new possibilities

option_a.text: Make decisions quickly to move forward

option_b.text: Gather more information before deciding

option_a.text: Planned with scheduled activities

option_b.text: Open with no fixed commitments

questions.text: I view rules and deadlines as:

option_a.text: Important structures to follow

option_b.text: Flexible guidelines to consider

questions.text: When starting my day, I prefer to:

option_a.text: Know what I'll be doing and when

option_b.text: See how the day unfolds naturally

questions.text: When someone really irritates me, I often later realize they remind me of qualities I dislike in myself
I notice that what bothers me most in others often reflects something I haven't accepted about myself
I can recognize parts of myself that I typically try to hide from others
I am aware of having contradictory aspects within my personality
I sometimes catch myself projecting my own issues onto others
I can embrace aspects of myself that I once rejected
I understand that my strong emotional reactions often point to unresolved personal issues
I am working on integrating the parts of myself I used to deny
I recognize that my harshest judgments of others often apply to myself
I can see how my unconscious patterns influence my behavior
I often feel like I'm on a quest or journey in life
I feel drawn to help and nurture others
I seek to understand the deeper truths of existence
I feel compelled to create and innovate
I often challenge the status quo and established systems
I use humor to navigate life's challenges
I feel called to lead and take responsibility
I am driven to explore and seek new experiences
I believe in the power of transformation and change
I value authenticity and being true to myself above all
I feel I am becoming more whole and integrated as a person
I am comfortable with paradoxes and contradictions in life
I have a clear sense of my life's purpose
I can hold multiple perspectives without needing to choose sides
I feel connected to something larger than myself
I have integrated lessons from my past experiences
I am at peace with aspects of myself I once struggled with
I understand my place in the larger scheme of things
I have developed my own values independent of external influences
I experience a sense of inner unity despite life's complexities
